descriptionModule.briefSummary: The PROWL registry is an open-label retrospective, multi-center, US study of the Surmodics™ Pounce™ Thrombectomy System for the non-surgical removal of emboli and thrombi in the peripheral arterial vasculature.

armGroups.label: Retrospective
armGroups.description: All subjects in whom the Pounce Thrombectomy System was attempted will be included.

interventions.name: Pounce Thrombectomy System
interventions.description: Non-surgical removal of thrombi and emboli from the peripheral arterial vasculature with the Pounce Thrombectomy System.

primaryOutcomes.description: Restoration of pulsatile flow in the target lesion(s) with or without adjunctive treatment as determined by the core lab and physician
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Peri-procedural (by the end of the index procedure)

primaryOutcomes.measure: Incidence of device related Major Adverse Events (MAEs)
primaryOutcomes.description: Death, Unplanned major amputation (above ankle), Clinically Driven target lesion revascularization (TLR)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Technical success
secondaryOutcomes.description: Restoration of blood flow to the target lesion(s) with \<50% residual thrombus without the need to initiate CDT or to proceed to open surgery or other endovascular thrombectomy device as determined by the core lab
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Peri-procedural (by the end of the index procedure)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Completeness of thromboemboli removal (by angiography)
secondaryOutcomes.description: Completeness of thromboemboli removal (by angiography) not including underlying atheroma as determined by the core lab and physician
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Peri-procedural (by the end of the index procedure)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Thrombo-aspiration in Peripheral Interventions (TIPI) flow rate
secondaryOutcomes.description: TIPI flow rate at the end of thrombectomy procedure and after any adjunctive procedures as determined by the core lab and physician.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Peri-procedural (by the end of the index procedure)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Modified Society for Vascular Surgery (SVS) runoff
secondaryOutcomes.description: Pre-procedure vs. post-procedure runoff using a modified SVS runoff score as determined by the core lab and physician (if applicable).
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Pre-procedure, Peri-procedural (by the end of the index procedure)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Underlying atheroma stenosis
secondaryOutcomes.description: Length of underlying atheroma stenosis necessitating treatment compared to original lesion length as determined by the core lab and physician
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Peri-procedural (by the end of the index procedure)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Describe index procedural characteristics
secondaryOutcomes.description:
Number of passes of Pounce Thrombectomy System

* Total number of passes
* Number of passes in each vessel
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Peri-procedural (by the end of the index procedure)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Adjunctive procedures
secondaryOutcomes.description:
Percentage of subjects in whom adjunctive procedures were performed

▪ Treatment for: underlying atheroma, residual thrombus, residual embolus, other
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Peri-procedural (by the end of the index procedure)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Index procedure durations
secondaryOutcomes.description: Total procedure duration (minutes) Duration of Pounce Thrombectomy System use (minutes)
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Peri-procedural (by the end of the index procedure)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Characterize subject index procedure hospitalization course at discharge
secondaryOutcomes.description: Length of stay
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Index procedure hospital admission to discharge, approximately 1 to 2 days

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Characterize subject index procedure hospitalization course at discharge
secondaryOutcomes.description: Time from end of procedure to discharge
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Index procedure hospital admission to discharge, approximately 1 to 2 days

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Characterize subject index procedure hospitalization course at discharge
secondaryOutcomes.description: Incidence of same day discharge
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Index procedure hospital admission to discharge, approximately 1 to 2 days

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Characterize subject index procedure hospitalization course at discharge
secondaryOutcomes.description: Incidence of next day discharge
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Index procedure hospital admission to discharge, approximately 1 to 2 days

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Characterize subject index procedure hospitalization course at discharge
secondaryOutcomes.description: Incidence of ICU admission
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Index procedure hospital admission to discharge, approximately 1 to 2 days

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Characterize subject index procedure hospitalization course at discharge
secondaryOutcomes.description: Duration of ICU admission
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Index procedure hospital admission to discharge, approximately 1 to 2 days

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Primary vessel patency
secondaryOutcomes.description: Determined by the investigator using DUS or ABI
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: 30 days

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Rutherford class (if applicable)
secondaryOutcomes.description: Improvement by at least one class at 30 days as compared to procedure
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Procedure to 30 days

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Rutherford classification (if applicable)
secondaryOutcomes.description: Characterize Rutherford classification
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Baseline, at hospital discharge (approximately 1-2 days), 30 days

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Ankle Brachial Index (ABI)
secondaryOutcomes.description: Change in ABI at 30 days compared to baseline.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Baseline to 30 days

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Incidence of device related arterial AEs
secondaryOutcomes.description: Major bleeding (requiring transfusion) Arterial perforation Flow-limiting dissection (at the end of the procedure, prior to and following stenting, if performed) Distal embolization requiring surgical procedure or obstructing one of the major downstream vessels \>70% (at the end of the procedure)
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: 30 days

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Incidence of all-cause: Death Unplanned major amputation (above ankle) Clinically driven TLR Clinically driven TVR
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: 30 days

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Incidence of: Procedure-related SAEs Device-related (S)AEs
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: 30 days

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Incidence of: Compartment syndrome requiring fasciotomy Major bleeding (requiring transfusion) unrelated to device
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: 30 days

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Incidence of index procedure access site complications
secondaryOutcomes.description:
Infection (requiring IV antibiotics or surgical treatment) Pseudoaneurysm (requiring surgical or endovascular treatment) Seroma (requiring surgical treatment) Other access site related AEs

* Numbness
* Other
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: 30 days

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Subject underwent an endovascular intervention where the Pounce Thrombectomy System was attempted
* Subject is willing and able to provide informed consent prior to the collection of study data or a consent waiver is in place

Exclusion Criteria:

* Subject is under the age of 18 years
eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: Adult subjects who have had an endovascular intervention where use of the Pounce Thrombectomy System was attempted
